ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Good for a continuation of Stat 1.

I would recommend this course for every student serious about being a sociologist. It is a great introduction into the basics of statical analysis that is a huge component of the field. The course is particularly valuable because it shows how statistics may be useful for those not necessarily "quant" minded. Vida's a great teacher, and the material great for all.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: helped me learn useful statistical models.

This course really opened my eyes to some of the possibilities in statistical modeling. Specifically it forced me to really value statistics as a tool in our discipline, and also stir my imagination for possible projects in the future.

I enjoyed working through the published papers in the final semester but felt like the first semester was not helpful or relevant to the complex work being done in the field. I do not plan on pursuing statistical methods, though I see the value in learning the methodology. In fact, I think the second semester is the more important material to learn for all first year students. But having a full-year course can be overwhelming and disengaging for burnt out students who would otherwise be engaged with the material.
